citation.article-title: Lactobacillus sanfrancisco sp. nov., nom. rev.

p.s: Description of Lactobacillus sanfrancisco sp. nov., nom. rev.

Lactobacillus sanfrancisco (san . fran . cis' co. M.L. n. sanfrancisco San Francisco, named after the city where the sourdoughs from which the organism was first isolated have been propagated for more than 100 years)
Gram-positive, non spore-forming rods with rounded ends, generally 0.6 to 0.8 by 2 to 4 μm, occurring singly and in pairs.
Requires the addition of freshly prepared yeast extractives to media for good growth.
Microaerophilic; growth is enhanced by reduced O2 pressure and CO2.
Slightly acidophilic; favourable initial pH for growth is around 5.5.
Growth occurs between 13 and 40°C with an optimum at 30°C.
Heterofermentative; CO2, acetic acid (ethanol), and DL-lactic acid are formed from hexoses and gluconate.

Only glucose, galactose, maltose, and gluconate are fermented, arabinose, cellobiose, fructose, lactose, mannitol, mannose, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, rhamnose, ribose, salicin, sorbitol, sucrose, trehalose, and xylose not fermented.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite; indole and H2 negate.
Electrophoretic mobility of L-LDH and D-LDH are 1.05 and 1.18, respectively.
Cell walls contain murrain of the Lys-Ala type and no teichoic acid.
The G + C content of the DNA is 36 to 38 mol%. (Tm).
Type strain: NRRL B-3934 (L-12, ATCC 27651, DSM 20451)
